column1: Nala was in her room ready to sleep. Nala wants to have a good night's sleep without any nightmares. The door to Nala's room is locked. A purple butterfly flies into the room through the open window. Nala doesn't see the purple butterfly.
column2: Does Nala think the door to her room is locked or unlocked?
column3: Nala believes the door to her room is locked.
column4: Nala believes the door to her room is unlocked.

column1: Hugo was in the park with his friends. Hugo wanted to win the kite flying contest. The string of Hugo's kite was strong. A squirrel runs by with a nut in its mouth. Hugo doesn't see the squirrel.
column2: Does Hugo think the string of his kite is strong or weak?
column3: Hugo believes the string of his kite is strong.
column4: Hugo believes the string of his kite is weak.

column1: Ravi was at the fish market. Ravi wanted to buy a fish for his mom to cook for dinner. The fish on the scale was heavy. A scared cat runs through the fish market. Ravi doesn't see the scared cat.
column2: Does Ravi believe the fish on the scale is heavy or light?
column3: Ravi believes the fish on the scale is heavy.
column4: Ravi believes the fish on the scale is light.

column1: Vito was at a birthday party. Vito wanted to give his friend a special gift. The gift was wrapped in a shiny paper. A clown comes into the room to perform a magic show. Vito doesn't see the clown because he is still in the other room.
column2: Does Vito think the gift is wrapped or unwrapped?
column3: Vito believes the gift is wrapped.
column4: Vito believes the gift is unwrapped.

column1: Tim was in the kitchen, ready to make lunch. Tim wanted to make a big bowl of pasta. The pasta box was full. A bird flies into the kitchen through the open window. Tim does not see the bird.
column2: Does Tim think the pasta box is full or not?
column3: Tim believes the pasta box is full.
column4: Tim believes the pasta box is not full.

column1: Wendy was in the park, sitting on a bench. Wendy wanted to play a charming tune on her small flute. The flute was in her bag. A squirrel runs up a tree nearby. Wendy doesn't see the squirrel.
column2: Does Wendy think her flute is in her bag or in the lost and found box?
column3: Wendy believes her flute is in her bag.
column4: Wendy believes her flute is in the lost and found box.

column1: Gigi was at the park with her friends. Gigi wanted to share her mints with her friends. The mint box was full of fat, healthy mints. A rainbow appears in the sky. Gigi doesn't see the rainbow.
column2: Does Gigi think the mints in the box are fat and healthy or nibbled and sickly?
column3: Gigi believes the mints in the box are fat and healthy.
column4: Gigi believes the mints in the box are nibbled and sickly.

column1: Remy was in the park playing with his colorful parrot. Remy wanted his parrot to learn a new trick. The parrot was sitting on a clear and open branch. A squirrel runs across the park. Remy doesn't see the squirrel because he is too focused on his game.
column2: Does Remy think his parrot is sitting on a clear and open branch or an obscured branch?
column3: Remy believes his parrot is sitting on a clear and open branch.
column4: Remy believes his parrot is sitting on an obscured branch.
column5: the branch the parrot is sitting on

column1: Pete was at the park, ready to eat his lunch. Pete wanted to enjoy his food while watching the birds. The food in Pete's lunch box was fresh and yummy. A patient dog sits down next to Pete, watching him. Pete doesn't see the patient dog.
column2: Does Pete think his food is fresh and yummy or bitten by a squirrel?
column3: Pete believes his food is fresh and yummy.
column4: Pete believes his food has been bitten by a squirrel.

column1: Quin was in the park with his gray paint and brush. Quin wanted to paint a big tree on a big balloon. The balloon was empty. A squirrel runs past Quin, carrying a nut. Quin doesn't see the squirrel.
column2: Does Quin think the balloon is empty or filled with air?
column3: Quin believes the balloon is empty.
column4: Quin believes the balloon is filled with air.

column1: Yara was at a party with her friends. Yara wanted to sing her favorite song for everyone. The microphone was working fine. A dog runs into the party and starts to play with the balloons. Yara doesn't see the dog playing with the balloons.
column2: Does Yara think the microphone is working fine or has stopped working?
column3: Yara believes the microphone is working fine.
column4: Yara believes the microphone has stopped working.

column1: Sam was at the space station, waiting to travel back to Earth. Sam wants to return home to see his family. The spaceship's launch schedule was synchronized with Earth's rotation. A shooting star passes by the space station. Sam doesn't see the shooting star.
column2: Does Sam believe the spaceship's launch schedule is synchronized or asynchronous with Earth's rotation?
column3: Sam believes the spaceship's launch schedule is synchronized with Earth's rotation.
column4: Sam believes the spaceship's launch schedule is asynchronous with Earth's rotation.

column1: Ina was at the park, sitting on a gray bench. Ina wanted to solve the puzzle in her story book. The puzzle in the story book was hard. A squirrel runs across the park. Ina doesn't see the squirrel.
column2: Does Ina think the puzzle in the story book is hard or solved?
column3: Ina believes the puzzle in the story book is hard.
column4: Ina believes the puzzle in the story book is solved.

column1: Lenny was at the market to buy a smelly cheese. Lenny wanted to find the best smelly cheese for his mom. The cheese was very expensive. A juggler starts performing in the middle of the market. Lenny does not see the juggler.
column2: Does Lenny think the cheese is expensive or damaged and therefore less expensive?
column3: Lenny believes the cheese is very expensive.
column4: Lenny believes the cheese is damaged and therefore less expensive.

column1: Kip was at the mall looking at a beautiful painting. Kip wanted to buy the painting to put it in his room. The painting was very expensive. A clown starts to make balloon animals near the painting. Kip doesn't see the clown because he is still in the other store.
column2: Does Kip think the painting is very expensive or on sale?
column3: Kip believes the painting is very expensive.
column4: Kip believes the painting is on sale.

column1: Jake was in the kitchen ready to make dinner. Jake wanted to make a big salad with all the fresh groceries he bought. The knife he uses to cut veggies was very sharp. A reliable old friend calls Jake on the phone. Jake doesn't hear the phone ringing because he's busy in the kitchen.
column2: Does Jake think the knife is sharp or dull?
column3: Jake believes the knife is sharp.
column4: Jake believes the knife is dull.

column1: Yara was in the kitchen making a sandwich. Yara wanted to find the peanut butter in the cupboard to spread on her bread. The cupboard door was flat and straight. A parrot flies into the kitchen through the open window. Yara doesn't see the parrot.
column2: Does Yara think the cupboard door is flat and straight or warped?
column3: Yara believes the cupboard door is flat and straight.
column4: Yara believes the cupboard door is warped.

column2: Does Dora think the book she wants is on the top shelf or on the floor?
column3: Dora believes the book she wants is on the top shelf.
column4: Dora believes the book she wants is on the floor.

column1: Xander was in the forest, looking for deer. Xander wanted to find a deer to take a picture. The deer was hidden in the bushes. A comfortable breeze blows through the forest. Xander doesn't feel the comfortable breeze because he is focused on his camera.
column2: Does Xander think the deer is hidden in the bushes or running out in the open?
column3: Xander believes the deer is hidden in the bushes.
column4: Xander believes the deer is running out in the open.

column1: Remy was at the park playing with his toy car. Remy wants to stay at the park until the sun goes down. The toy car was fully charged. A flock of birds suddenly flies over the park. Remy doesn't see the flock of birds.
column2: Does Remy think his toy car is fully charged or drained?
column3: Remy believes his toy car is fully charged.
column4: Remy believes his toy car is drained.

column2: Does Ed think his bottle of water is full or empty?
column3: Ed believes his bottle of water is full.
column4: Ed believes his bottle of water is empty.

column2: Does Caden think his toy lizard is clean and shiny or dirty?
column3: Caden believes his toy lizard is clean and shiny.
column4: Caden believes his toy lizard is dirty.

column2: Does Tilly think the rat is in its hole or scared away?
column3: Tilly believes the rat is in its hole.
column4: Tilly believes the rat is scared away.

column2: Does Fergus think the stick is on the ground or has it become lighter?
column3: Fergus believes the stick is on the ground.
column4: Fergus believes the stick has become lighter.

column2: Does Darius think the ink in the bottle is full and fluid or dry and hard?
column3: Darius believes the ink in the bottle is full and fluid.
column4: Darius believes the ink in the bottle is dry and hard.

column3: Kiki believes the sand is cool and undisturbed.
column4: Kiki believes the sand is kicked up and disturbed.

column2: Does Xander think the egg is still not cooked or partially cooked?

column4: Xander believes the egg is partially cooked.

column2: Does Yara think the ice cream mix is thick and creamy or frozen?
column3: Yara believes the ice cream mix is still thick and creamy.

column3: Sam believes the sink is clean.

column2: Does Adam believe the lab clock is synchronized with the school's main clock or asynchronous?

column4: Adam believes the lab clock is asynchronous with the school's main clock.

column1: Ollie was in the kitchen ready to make dinner. Ollie wanted to cut some veggies for a fine soup. The knife was sharp and ready to use. A song about a journey starts playing on the radio. Ollie doesn't hear the song because he is focused on his cooking.
column2: Does Ollie think the knife is sharp or dull?

column3: Lenny believes the subway tracks are aligned.
column4: Lenny believes the subway tracks were misaligned but are now aligned.

column1: Xander was in the park playing a game of knights with his friends. Xander wanted to be the best knight and protect his friends with his shield. The shield Xander was using was made of cardboard and was originally opaque. A dog runs past the children playing the game. Xander doesn't see the dog running past.
column2: Does Xander think his shield is opaque or transparent?
column3: Xander believes his shield is opaque.
column4: Xander believes his shield is transparent.

A street musician starts playing a song outside the coffee shop. Noah doesn't hear the street musician playing a song as he is still looking at his phone.

column3: Noah believes the coffee machine is working.

column3: Finn believes the shark cage is open.

column2: Does Flora think the cap on the bottle is twisted or untwisted?

column4: Flora believes the cap on the bottle is untwisted.

column1: Gus was at the park drawing pictures with his crayons. Gus wanted to draw a big, beautiful rainbow. The box of crayons was full of many colors. A gentle breeze blows through the park, rustling the leaves. Gus does not feel the gentle breeze as he is focused on his drawing.

column4: Gus believes the box of crayons has spilled out.

column3: Xander believes the cloth bag of seeds is full.
column4: Xander believes the cloth bag of seeds is emptying.

column1: Jax was at the beach on a hot day. Jax wanted to swim in the sea to cool down. The water in the sea was fresh and clean. A seagull swoops down and steals Jax's sandwich. Jax doesn't see the seagull stealing his sandwich.
column2: Does Jax think the water in the sea is fresh or stagnant?
column3: Jax believes the water in the sea is fresh.
column4: Jax believes the water in the sea is stagnant.

column1: Ben was at a party with his friends. Ben wanted to welcome his new friend, Lily, to the party. The big mirror in the hall was clean and shiny. A balloon pops in the other room. Ben doesn't hear the balloon pop because of the loud music.
column2: Does Ben think the mirror is clean and shiny or smudgy and less reflective?
column3: Ben believes the mirror is clean and shiny.
column4: Ben believes the mirror is smudgy and less reflective.
column5: The big mirror in the hall.

column1: Pete was in the park playing on the monkey bars. Pete wanted to climb to the highest bar. The monkey bar was very strong. A bird lands on Pete's nose. Pete doesn't feel the bird landing on his nose.
column2: Does Pete think the monkey bar is strong or less strong?
column3: Pete believes the monkey bar is strong.
column4: Pete believes the monkey bar is less strong.
